D-hp3wDV.title: Italian Rock Bands

queries.query:
SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(?item) AS ?count) 

WHERE { 

     ?band ?a wd:Q5741069 . # rock band  

     ?band wdt:P495 wd:Q38 . # from italy

     ?band wdt:P527 ?item .  

     SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". 

          ?band rdfs:label         ?label. 

      } 

  

  

  

} 

GROUP BY ?label 

ORDER BY DESC(?count) 

LIMIT 30

SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(distinct ?band) as ?count)  

WHERE { 

     ?band ?a wd:Q5741069 . # rock band  

     ?band wdt:P495 wd:Q38 . # from italy

     ?band wdt:P737 ?influencer . 

          SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". 

          ?influencer rdfs:label         ?label. 

      } 

} 

  

GROUP BY ?label ?count  

ORDER BY DESC(?count) 

LIMIT 20

SELECT ?year (COUNT(?band) AS ?count)
WHERE {
  FILTER(?inceptionYear >= xsd:dateTime("1950-01-01T00:00:00Z"))
  ?band wdt:P31 wd:Q5741069;           # Instance of: rock band
        wdt:P495 wd:Q38;               # Country of origin: Italy
        wdt:P571 ?inceptionYear.       # Year of inception

  BIND(YEAR(?inceptionYear) AS ?year)
  
  SERVICE wikibase:label {
    bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en".
    ?band rdfs:label ?label.
  }
}
GROUP BY ?year
ORDER BY xsd:integer(?year)
LIMIT 20

texts: With their distinct sound and engaging performances, Italian rock bands have made an unforgettable impression on the music scene. These bands have played a significant role in establishing the Italian rock scene and pushing limits within the genre since the 1960s and continue to do so now. Legendary rose to prominence in the 1970s, infusing their music with progressive rock elements, sophisticated melodies, and thought-provoking lyrics. These bands pushed the envelope, enthralling listeners with their technical prowess and creative soundscapes. Italian rock took a more accessible and commercial turn in the 1980s, mixing elements of punk, new wave, and pop rock into their music. Their upbeat performances and appealing lyrics drew a broader audience, catapulting them to national success. Alternative and indie rock bands emerged in the 1990s and early 2000s, bringing a fresh and varied approach to rock music, merging numerous genres and introducing electronic elements. Their thoughtful lyrics and distinct sound environments spoke to a generation searching for a new musical identity.

New Dada is a 1960s Italian rock band that combines popular songs with experimental noises and literary lyrics. They were a member of the beat and psychedelic rock movements and became well-known for songs such as "L'ora dell'amore" and "L'ultimo giorno di Pompei." Despite their brief existence, New Dada had a lasting effect on the Italian rock music scene, influencing future generations of musicians. Their music is still regarded as a monument to the dynamic age of Italian rock in the 1960s.

Italian rock bands have thrived in recent years, with performers like Måneskin achieving international fame for their blend of rock, glam, and modern pop elements. These bands demonstrate the ever-changing character of Italian rock by pushing boundaries and attracting audiences with exciting performances. 

Måneskin is a rock band from Italy recognized for their engaging energy and distinct combination of rock, glam, and punk elements. After winning the Eurovision Song Contest in 2021, they achieved international acclaim. Måneskin has become one of the most prominent rock bands of recent times, attracting listeners worldwide with addictive songs and a raw, rebellious energy.

Italian rock bands have made an unmistakable influence on the music world, from the 1960s and progressive rock of the 1970s through the alternative and indie sounds of the 1990s and beyond. They continue to influence and define the Italian rock scene for future generations with their different genres, distinctive inventiveness, and impassioned performances.

7qpfziir.title: Exploring the Rock music genre

queries.query:
SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(distinct ?band) as ?count) 
WHERE {
     ?band ?a wd:Q5741069 . # rock band 
     ?band wdt:P495 wd:Q30 . # from USA
     ?band wdt:P737 ?influencer .
          SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en".
          ?influencer rdfs:label         ?label.
      }
}

GROUP BY ?label ?count 
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
LIMIT 10

SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(?date) AS ?count) 
WHERE { ?genre ?a wd:Q188451 .
        ?genre wdt:P279* wd:Q11399.
        ?genre wdt:P571 ?date . 
       SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". ?date rdfs:label ?label. } 
       FILTER(YEAR(?date)  >= 1978 && YEAR(?date) <= 2001)
      } 
GROUP BY ?label 
ORDER BY ASC(?label) 
LIMIT 30

SELECT DISTINCT ?point ?pointLabel ?countryLabel ?lat ?long
WHERE {
?point wdt:P31 wd:Q188451 .
  ?point wdt:P279 wd:Q11399 .
  ?point wdt:P495 ?country.
?country p:P625 ?statement .  
?statement psv:P625 ?node. ?node wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat ; wikibase:geoLongitude ?long.
SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". } }
LIMIT 500

texts: As reported by Encyclopedia Britannica, "Rock, also called rock and roll [...] is a form of popular music that emerged in the 1950s. It is certainly arguable that by the end of the 20th century rock was the world’s dominant form of popular music". It is precisely its popularity that makes this genre so worthy of further study. Examining the evolution of rock music across different eras and geographical boundaries, this investigation delves into the genre's transformation over time while shedding light on the involvment of women within this musical landscape.
The first rock bands were born in the 1950s, in fact here we can see the number of bands born in the 50s, 60s and 70s: rock bands became more and more popular with each passing decade
Let's now take a look at the most influential rock bands in the USA
Let's focus on the band Nirvana. What are the roles played by its members?

Each member plays more than one role in the band, four out of five play guitar, including Kurt Cobain, who sings and plays guitar. But who else is connected to the band Nirvana and Cobain and plays guitar, besides singing? His wife Courtney Love, singer and guitarist of American rock band Hole.
This band is composed solely of women. Something that might come as a surprise, as one does not often hear of all-female rock bands. Let us see if the numbers support this perception.

Let’s now have a look at how rock evolved throughout the years.

Over time, rock has become increasingly diversified and so many different sub-genres have emerged that differ from the original genre but retain some of its features. We can see an explosion of new genres between the 1980 and 1995, but the trend declines as we enter the 2000s.

Now let's go back to Rock music.

It is arguably one of the most popular music genres ever; but does this apply to all the nations of the world? We can check this by entering the name of a nation; we will then find all the bands of that nationality.

If interested in the foundation date of the band, one can check it by clicking on "Show foundation year".

texts: Our project aims at sharing general information about theatres with a focus on UK and the most played genre in theatres: classical music. With the newer generations, theatres have lost their popularity and rarely see young people amongst their audience. With our project we hope to raise our peers' interests about theatres.

The United Kingdom has a rich and vibrant theatrical tradition, with a diverse range of theaters spread across the country. The theaters in the UK cater to a wide range of tastes and interests, offering a diverse array of productions, from classic plays to cutting-edge performances.

Fun facts about some theatres in London

Savoy Theatre was the world's first public venue to be lit wholly by electricity

In 1881, Savoy Theatre was the first venue to be lit wholly by electricity, and its owner D'Oyly Carte even took to the stage to smash a light bulb to prove that this new technology was totally safe.

Peacock Theatre is allegedly haunted by ghost dolphins

Apparently, in the 1970s two dolphins were kept in tanks under the stage, ready to star in a variety show - but they died of neglect, and their ghosts still haunt the venue to this day.

The Globe Theatre is the only central London building with a thatched roof

Since the Great Fire of London in 1666, there's been a law against buildings having thatched roofs. So when Shakespeare's Globe Theatre was built in 1997, it had to seek special permission to replicate the thatched roof of Shakespeare's day.

The Globe Theatre is a famous historical landmark associated with the works of William Shakespeare. The original Globe Theatre was built in 1599 in London, England, by Shakespeare's playing company, the Lord Chamberlain's Men. It was situated on the south bank of the River Thames in the suburb of Southwark.

The theatre burned down in 1613 during a performance of Shakespeare's play "Henry VIII" when a cannon misfired and set fire to the thatched roof. However, it was quickly rebuilt on the same site the following year.

One of the previously mentioned composer is William Walton. William Walton was a renowned English composer of the 20th century. He was born in Oldham, Lancashire and his musical talents were recognized at an early age.

In his teenage years, Walton studied composition at the University of Oxford with famous British composer Sir Ernest William Moeran. During this time, he gained attention for his talent and caught the eye of influential figures in the music world. In 1922, Walton composed his "Viola Concerto," which marked a significant breakthrough in his career.

Classical music in theaters encompasses a rich and diverse tradition that includes opera, ballet, symphonic concerts, and other forms of musical performances. The combination of music, drama, and visual spectacle creates a unique and immersive experience for audiences.

texts: This project stems from an overview of string instruments, particularly guitars, which have marked an important turning point in the history of music. You will discover how the guitar has influenced not only culture and music, but also the sales market.

A stringed instrument refers to any musical instrument that produces sound by the vibration of stretched strings. This vibration creates many different types of stringed instruments: 449 is the number of types of stringed instruments existing in the world.
This number includes, however, many other realities, in particular the world of guitars. Here only the guitar types go up to 42832 different models.
Let’s now take a look at how the sounds of guitar are produced, based on the components of this instrument. Below, you are provided with a table with the different components that make up a guitar.

It can be seen from this table that the material that gives life to this instrument is wood. Almost all components are made of wood; in fact, wood is one of the factors that most influences the sound of a guitar. Its quality allows the strings to vibrate differently and determines the tone of the instrument. Yet, is it always just one type of wood? The answer is no. In fact, a specific wood is used for each guitar model. Depending on the model of the guitar (e.g., Ibanez, Fender, etc. ) we will have different types of wood (e.g., poplar wood, maple wood, mahogany wood and rosewood).

To give an idea of how the wood type look like, an image of it is provided by clicking "Show the image".

The presence of various types of guitars gives rise to different market demands, which vary according to the uses and types most valued by the guitar users. Here, then, two different tables are shown to present the number of acoustic and electric guitars sold over a period of time that goes from 1990 to 2016.

As we can seen, not only do we have a greater number of sales of electric guitars, but more importantly these are concentrated around 1995, a year when rock-n roll had great success, but also around 2016, a year when the rock-n roll revival played an important role in the history of music. From here, the question arises as to what factors influenced these sales: hence, in the chart below the most influential guitarists are shown who boosted guitars sales.

The influence of the American guitarists has since spread throughout the world and thus, as the map shows, different countries have a higher or lower number of guitarists who have influenced their respective cultures (eg., Fabrizio De Andrè in Italy).

v4h_GSI0.title: The Beatles

queries.query:

WHERE {

texts: The Beatles, one of the most iconic bands in music history, have left an indelible mark on the world. In this project, we explore their success and profound influence on society. We uncover the story of The Beatles and explore why their music continues to captivate and inspire generations. Through this story, you will gain a deeper understanding of the band's enduring legacy and their impact on popular culture.

The members of band were highly skilled and versatile musicians, proficient in playing multiple instruments. Their musical talents and ability to switch roles within the band contributed to the diverse and innovative sound that defined their music.

The Beatles' mastery of multiple instruments allowed them to experiment with different sounds, genres, and musical styles, pushing the boundaries of popular music and contributing to their unparalleled musical legacy.

texts: the present work is aimed at analysing pop bands phenomenon in Italy, with a particular focus on the scena bolognese

Divertitevi ragazzi. Suonate. Cantate. State bene e in pace. 

Bologna è la città della musica, del saper vivere, della libertà.

Cesare Cremonini
Pooh is a successful Italian pop band which was formed in Bologna, in 1966. Songs Dammi solo un minuto and Uomini soli are instances of their successful career.

Stadio is an Italian band which was formed in Bologna a decade later, in 1977. They started out as Lucio Dalla’s supporting band, who featured them in his Anidride Solforosa album. Their breakthrough arrived when they produced Verdone’s Acqua e Sapone (1983) soundtrack.

They worked with artists covering an essential role in the scena bolognese such as Lucio Dalla, Gianni Morandi, Francesco Guccini, Vasco Rossi and Luca Carboni. They won Sanremo Music Festival in 2016, with song Un giorno mi dirai.

Lunapop formed in 1999 and split up in 2002. 

Among them, frontman Cesare Cremonini pursued a career in music along with bassist Nicola "Ballo" Balestri.

Lunapop won the Festival di San Marino with song Qualcosa di Grande, which allowed them to be scouted by an indie label, which produced their album Squerez. Their debut single, 50 Special, has become an Italian cult. Other singles include Un Giorno Migliore, Se Ci Sarai, Resta con Me and Vorrei.

Lo Stato Sociale is an Italian band formed in 2009, in Bologna.

Stato Sociale was the runner-up in Festival di Sanremo 2018, with their song Una Vita in Vacanza.

It’s not uncommon for artists to travel the world in order to find recording studios whose atmosphere inspires them the most. For instance, on February 2023, Cesare Cremonini flew to Seattle to record his new album at Robert Lang Studios in Shoreline, where Nirvana would record their songs. Whereas Maggese (2005) was entirely recorded between the Abbey Road Studios and the Olympic Studios in London. Similarly, La Ragazza del Futuro (2022) was recorded at the Abbey Road Studios.

Bologna is commonly known as la Grassa, la Rossa, la Dotta. Theatres have always contributed to the cultural turmoil of the city. Bolognese artists have therefore shown deep fondness for theatres. For instance, Lo Stato Sociale used their exhibition at the Festival di Sanremo 2021 to appeal for a re-opening of theatres. Cesare Cremonini, on the other hand, self-financed his Maggese Theatre Tour.

«Gli applausi in un teatro hanno un suono particolare, ti piovono addosso come un temporale improvviso. Ma la cosa più emozionante è stata riuscire a far scoppiare a ridere il pubblico con una battuta. È un sogno che mi portavo dietro fin da bambino, quando all'asilo mettevo tutti i miei compagni di giochi sulle scale e cercavo di farli ridere rendendomi ridicolo.»

Cesare Cremonini about his Theatre Tour

texts: Get ready for an amazing adventure into the world of rock music in the USA. We'll explore the huge number of bands, the exciting stadiums they perform in, and the talented members that make up these groups. We'll also discover when these bands formed. Along the way, we'll see cool pictures of rock bands and their unique styles. Plus, we'll dive into the story of Guns N' Roses, learning about their band members, hit albums, and when they were released. In addition, during our journey we have also encountered the majestic band of the Red Hot Chili Peppers. Get ready to rock out to the incredible music and stories that define American rock!

r7i-PG2n.title: Sounds of Bologna: Exploring the MusicBo Corpus' People and Cities

}

WHERE {?s rdf:type amr:City.
}

PREFIX owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX wdt: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/direct/>
PREFIX wikibase: <http://wikiba.se/ontology#>
PREFIX p: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/>
PREFIX wd: <http://www.wikidata.org/entity/>
PREFIX ps: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/statement/>
PREFIX psv: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/statement/value/>
PREFIX wdr: <http://www.w3.org/2007/05/powder#>
PREFIX amr: <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/>

SELECT DISTINCT ?point ?label ?frameInstance ?lat ?long

WHERE { 

  ?cityUri rdf:type amr:City ; 
    owl:sameAs ?point ; 
    amr:name ?label .

  FILTER (regex(str(?point), "http://www.wikidata.org/entity/", "i"))

  ?frameInstance ?p ?cityUri ; 
    rdf:type ?frame . 
SERVICE <https://query.wikidata.org/bigdata/namespace/wdq/sparql> 
  { ?point wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q515 . 
    ?point p:P625 ?coords_stmt . 
    ?coords_stmt ps:P625 ?coords;
      psv:P625 [ wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat; wikibase:geoLongitude ?long ] . 

  }
  }

PREFIX amr: <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/>
PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>

 
SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(distinct ?s) as ?count)
WHERE 
{?s rdf:type amr:City ; 
amr:name ?label  .
}

GROUP BY ?label ?count 
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
LIMIT 10

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX amr: <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/>

SELECT distinct ?label (COUNT(distinct ?s) as ?count)
WHERE {?s rdf:type <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/Person>. 
    ?s <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/name> ?label  .
}
 
GROUP BY ?label ?count 
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
LIMIT 10

texts: The MusicBo corpus consists of 135 texts that delve into the rich music heritage of Bologna. By exploring its knowledge graph, you can access data that offers both a quantitative and qualitative glimpse into the contents of the corpus. It's an innovative way to get a deeper understanding of the fascinating musical world of Bologna. Get ready for this amazing journey!

Let's start by taking a quick peek at the MusicBo corpus to see just how many people and cities are mentioned. This will give us a sense of the multitude of individuals and locations that contributed to Bologna's vibrant musical heritage.
Check out this map to discover which cities are specifically mentioned in the MusicBo corpus!

Did you notice that the cities are highly concentrated in Europe?

This can be also attributed to the Grand Tour, started in the XVIII century. This significant phenomenon allowed musicians, composers, and also music enthusiasts to visit prominent cities, like Bologna, and initiate a cultural exchange that involved the entire Europe. As a matter of fact, the Grand Tour had a profound impact on the dissemination of Bologna's music heritage across the continent.
As we continue our journey of MusicBo's discovery, there's one question we need to ask: who are the top 10 people that appear the most in the corpus?

And the prize for the most cited person in the MusicBo corpus goes to... Gioacchino Rossini!

Such an important person deserves a worthy introduction. Get ready to discover some biographical information, his notable works, and the cities that embraced his talent. But that's not all: you'll also see an image of this extraordinary musical genius!

Many are the cities that embraced Rossini’s talent and were influenced by his musical genius.  

But why is Rossini so popular? The MusicBo corpus reveals some reasons behind his fame: 

Music in the Present Tense Rossini Italian's Operas in Their Time, Emanuele Senici (2019)

The music of Rossini is universally appreciated for no other reason than because his melodies are either entirely popular, and lifted, so to speak, from the mouths of the people; or resemble those successions of tones which the people are generally familiar with and have become accustomed to, that is, popular.

At times it seems almost as if Rossini is some sort of 1950s rock ’n’ roll star, out to corrupt young, impressionable, and, yes, mostly female minds with his “physical” music.

Carpani goes on to list the myriad forms in which Rossini’s music spread throughout Italy and the many different nonoperatic situations in which it featured: military marches, Tafelmusik, church organs, orchestral accompaniment to theatrical dance, the tavern, the street, the salon, pianos, and so on: “We still haven’t heard this music only from church bells or repeated by the plumed inhabitants of wood trees.

Numerous people like him contributed to enriching Bologna's music scene and spreading its heritage all over the world. Do you want to know if a person played an important role in Bologna's music tradition?

texts: Throughout history, numerous women have become cultural icons and symbols of female empowerment, thanks to their unique talents, distinctive voices, and memorable hits. With this story we want to explore some of the most influential and successful female musicians of all time, who have sold millions of records and inspired countless people around the world.
This is the number of famous albums that sold at least 10 millions copies worldwide. In the music scene, this surely represents a measure of success and recognition for every event.
With this doughnut chart we want to represent the number of awards honoring female performers and songwriters for their career and artistic achievements in the music business.

Another significant recognition that female artists get for their artistic production is the nomination for awards and prizes. Similarly, the bar chart explores the number of nominations that the most popular female musicians received during their career.

tyK82z37.title: Exploring the life and works of Johann Sebastian Bach

queries.query:
SELECT DISTINCT ?father ?fatherLabel ?mother ?motherLabel 
WHERE {
wd:Q1339 wdt:P22 ?father. 
  ?father rdfs:label ?fatherLabel.
  wd:Q1339 wdt:P25 ?mother .
  ?mother rdfs:label ?motherLabel .
FILTER(LANG(?fatherLabel)="en"). 
FILTER (Lang(?motherLabel) ="en"). 
}

SELECT ?works ?worksLabel ?image ?genre ?genreLabel ?date
WHERE {
?works wdt:P86 wd:Q1339 . 
  ?works rdfs:label ?worksLabel .
  ?works wdt:P18 ?image .
  ?works wdt:P136 ?genre .
  ?genre rdfs:label ?genreLabel .
  ?works wdt:P577 ?date       
  FILTER(LANG(?worksLabel)="en").
  FILTER(LANG(?genreLabel)="en").
}
ORDER BY ASC(?date)

texts: The following data story explores the life and works of Johann Sebastian Bach with particular attention to his resonance in contemporary European culture and identity. We indeed believe that, apart from being just cultural products, cultural works (of whatever kind and of whatever genre) contribute to creating an idea of belonging and to shaping a common shared identity, a European one in our case. In the music field, Johann Sebastian Bach was one of those who mostly influenced the creation of a European cultural heritage. This story will be divided into two major parts: in the former we will present some bibliographical data on the composer in order to have a clear presentation on who he was, where he was born, what works he worked on and who he was influenced by; the latter, on the other hand, will deal more with the contemporary resonance that his works had - and still have - in our culture. We will indeed have a look at all those cultural products (concerts, books, films) which still echo Johann Sebastian Bach in contemporary culture.
Bach and his wives (he had two) had a huge family: together they had 20 children, as it can be seen in the counter. Moreover, he travelled little and mainly in Germany and he did not go abroad.

In his early life, Bach immediately entered in contact with music since his father already played an instrument and it was probably him who encouraged him to study music. As a matter of fact, in his childhood and as a young man he learnt to play many instruments, as it can be seen below. In his life he was a music teacher, a musicologist, a harpsichordist, a violinist, a choir director, an organist, a concertmaster, a virtuoso and obviously a composer.
Since a young age, Bach started his career as a composer. In his life he composed 25 notable works and 4 famous lists of works.
Furthermore, in his life Bach was influenced by other major European authors and composers, suggesting a European spirit and possibly a European cultural identity in progress of formation.

Finally, as for his contemporary resonance, we can argue that concerts with Bach’s music are still played and his music is still very much appreciated by contemporary audiences, sometimes without even knowing it (for instance, Piero Angela’s soundtrack of Superquark was Bach’s). Moreover, in the table below we can for example see how his figure is still very much present in present filmography and cinema.

To conclude, Johann Sebastian Bach was undoubtedly one of the most decisive composers in 18th century Europe and he deeply contributed in the formation of a European cultural and musical identity along with Mozart and Beethoven. This story has also demonstrated how his music still speaks volumes to contemporary audiences and had incredible resonance in both the 20th century as well. We can therefore affirm that this is indicative of his fortune but at the same it shows how he is linked to a European common taste and, as a consequence, also a European sense of belonging.

texts: The following story will explore the most significant points and events in Beethoven’s personal and professional life. In particular, it will focus on the cities he lived and worked in, the medical conditions that contributed to shaping his musical genius, his multifaceted field of work, the composers he was influenced by and his most notable works over the years. Lastly, we will present some of the ways in which he is still present in today’s culture through movies and TV products.

Ludwig van Beethoven was born in December 1770 in Bonn (Germany).

He came from a humble family with a strong musical background where his father recognised his talent right away and wanted to turn him into the "next Mozart". At a very early age he started receiving piano and violin lessons until he became a talented composer, pianist and conductor. During his life he suffered a series of illnesses, including the onset of deafness at 28 which worsened throughout his life until he became completely deaf. Despite this debilitating health condition, he composed 722 works, of which 9 symphonies, 35 piano sonatas and 16 string quartets. He died in Vienna on the 26th of March 1827 and his last words are believed to be "I will be able to hear in heaven!". He is one of the greatest classical composers in Western history and his myth still has an influence on today's cultural landscape.
Beethoven was born in Bonn, he worked mostly in Vienna and its surrounding area and moved back to Bonn for a brief period to attend to his sick mother.

During his life, Beethoven suffered a series of illnesses, some proven and other alleged. Nevertheless, they had a huge impact on his life and work, and they contributed to the myth of his feisty personality and musical genius.
Beethoven's resonance goes beyond his music and his time. He has become part of the Western cultural heritage and his myth has inspired many other works of art, even in recent times.

M9EZmoBI.title: Gaspare Spontini
texts: The following story will explore the WikiData knowledge base to discover the most significant points and events in the Italian composer Gaspare Spontini’s personal and professional life. We will start with a general exploration of the WikiData knowledge base to discover the quantity of people and artists in comparison with MusicBO and then we will narrow down our research analysing composers in WikiData, until finding our main object of the story: Gaspare Spontini. In particular, we will focus on his biography, his occupations and fields of work, the awards he received during his life, where he worked and the cities where he lived. There will be at the end an insight on the Museum Gaspare Spontini, its location and the visitors he had per year.
Thanks to these counters, we can compare the quantity of data concerning the people on Wikidata and the quantity of data in MusicBO.
Narrowing down the information from people to artist, we can compare with these counters the data on Wikidata compared to the data on MusicBO.

We focused our attention on composers.

We counted how many male and female composers were in Wikidata, and then how many male composers were born in Italy.

At this point, we searched a composer who was both in the Polifonia corpus and had lots of data on Wikidata, and we chose GASPARE SPONTINI.

Here it is an example of context from MusicBO:

“[...] a few of the chorus gathered in a semicircle around Spontini, in order to have a look at that remarkable man, as he held forth with wonderful effect on the requirements of true theatrical art.”

He was born in 1774 in Maiolati, which was at the time in the Papal State, now in the Province of Ancona. During his life, he spent most of his career abroad. He then returned to Italy and died in 1851 in Maiolati.

After studying at the conservatory in Naples with Nicola Sala as teacher, he then started working at some comedies in Italy. However, he spent most of his career life in Paris, where he started working at the Opéra becoming one of the greatest Italian composers of his age, admired by Cherubini, Beethoven, Weber and Rossini.

Because of the Bourbon Restoration, his works weren't considered as before, leading him to leave Paris for Berlin (at the time under the Kingdom of Prussia), where his operas had already achieved success, where he stayed until 1842.
He was a famous composer, conductor and musical director, mainly in the opera field, but also more generally in the music and conducting fields.

He was a member of the Académie des Beaux-Arts from June 15th 1839 when he replaced Ferdinando Paer, an Italian composer of German origins, to January 14th 1851 when he was then replaced by Ambroise Thomas, a French composer particularly famous for his work Mignon﻿.

During his life, he received many awards. In particular the award "Pour le Mérite for Sciences and Arts order" which is given to scientists and artists who have made an outstanding name for themselves through the widespread recognition of their achievements in science or the arts.

The Gaspare Spontini Museum is located in Maiolata Spontini, in the house where the composer and his wife spent the last years of their lives. Inside, we can find some music sheets, manuscripts, two pianos and some paintings depicting the staging of Spontini's French works, like The Miltondel, The Vestal and others.
This last chart shows us the number of visitors per year to the museum. In 2019 there was a high increase, however, probably due to Covid-19, the number of visitors decreased drastically in 2020.

texts: Indie rock is a genre of alternative rock music that emerged in the 1980s. Its name is derived from "independent" as it refers to the independent labels that produced this style of music. This genre is characterized by its non-conformist and do-it-yourself attitude, challenging traditional commercial standards. Indie rock has been associated with a wide range of subgenres, from jangly and upbeat pop-infused sounds to more experimental and introspective styles. Artists like Blur, Sonic Youth and Tame Impala have become iconic figures within the indie rock scene with their unique and innovative approaches. Firstly influenced by UK Rock, Punk Rock, Funk and House, this particular genre continues to grow, embracing new influences and pushing boundaries, while still staying true to its independent roots.

Blur, a British rock band formed in 1988, is renowned as one of the pioneers of the Britpop movement that dominated the UK music scene in the 1990s. Consisting of frontman Damon Albarn, guitarist Graham Coxon, bassist Alex James, and drummer Dave Rowntree, Blur effortlessly combined elements of indie rock, pop, and alternative music, creating a distinct and influential sound.

Their breakthrough came with the release of their third studio album, "Parklife," in 1994. The album marked a significant shift in their style, encapsulating the spirit of British culture and delivering catchy anthems with witty, observational lyrics. The success of "Parklife" propelled Blur and the Britpop movement into the mainstream, subsequently leading them to sell millions of records worldwide.

Today, Blur's legacy as one of the most influential and innovative bands of their era remains undeniable, with their distinctive blend of genres continuing to inspire musicians around the globe

Another influential and innovative band in alternative and indie rock history is the band Sonic Youth. Hailing from New York City, Sonic Youth's unique blend of experimental sounds and unconventional song structures pushed the boundaries of rock music while inspiring generations of musicians. Let's dive into a deeper understanding of this revolutionary band!

Sonic Youth's founding members are Thurston Moore, Kim Gordon, Lee Ranaldo, and Steve Shelley. Their music had a huge impact on the alternative and grunge scenes of the 90s, influencing bands like Nirvana, Pearl Jam, and Smashing Pumpkins. The band worked as pioneer in alternative rock, shaping the future of independent music, and has been central in the democratization of music-making, inspiring artists to explore unconventional sounds and challenge musical norms. From their early noise-driven days to their later experimentation and mainstream success, Sonic Youth consistently pushed boundaries and paved the way for countless artists to follow. Their legacy remains intact, forever changing the landscape of indierock music.

Let us now return to indie rock music. This genre has been gaining more and more popularity in recent years, not only in the US or the UK. If you are interested in discovering indie rock bands from a particular country, enter the name of the country in the search bar below!

You can also view individual band members by clicking on "Show band members".

texts: Folk music is the oldest form of Romanian musical creation, characterised by great vitality; it is the defining source of the cultured musical creation, both religious and lay. Conservation of Romanian folk music has been aided by a large and enduring audience, also by numerous performers who helped propagate and further develop the folk sound. One of them, Gheorghe Zamfir, is famous throughout the world today and helped popularize a traditional Romanian folk instrument, the panpipes. The present project aims to present a general view on some of the most famous Romanian musical bands, including pictures, with some more specific information on some musical groups.

texts: The following data story explores the life and career of one of the most influential and prolific composers of the classical period - Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. Throughout his 30-year-long career he created a huge number of composition in diverse genres, largely contributing to the enrichment of the western musical heritage. Along with other great composers of the golden era of music, such as Bach and Beethoven, Mozart left an indelible imprint on pages of the world music history, opening the door for several other brilliant composers that had yet to come. In the following data story we will touch upon some biographic data, putting an emphasis on the work activity of Mozart. Finally, we will investigate how Mozart is represented in contemporary culture.

His father and sister were artists as well. Leopold Mozart was a musician and he mainly worked at the court of Salzburg, where later his son will work too. Leopold recognised his son’s talent since he was a child and he made sure his son was known in the major courts of Europe. The Mozart family traveled a lot, however Wolfgang Mozart ended up working mainly in Salzburg and Wien. .
Mozart married Constanze Weber and they had two children

Mozart died young: he was only 35 years old, In his 26 years of activity he managed to create an enormous amount of masterpieces, which inspired his successors, e.g. Wagner and Beethoven. With his overall work he established a bridge between the Classical and Romantic music movements.
In some of his works, however, it is possible to trace the influence of other great composers of his time.
The huge number of Mozart’s followers on social media clearly expresses the love and admiration of the world for his music.

As the following table shows , the life and works of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart still represent a source of interest and entertainment: many movies, screenplays, tv series and books are made on his figure, his short but eventful life and on his evergreen music.

texts: The name alone conjures up a sense of magic, power, and limitless creativity. This American pop rock band has captivated millions of hearts and minds with their unique sound and heartfelt lyrics, leaving an indelible mark on the music industry. texts: This data story explores the resources available on Wikidata – the centralised, linked data repository for all Wikimedia projects – to overview the topic at hand from a statistical point of view, providing insight into the ever shifting landscape of the music industry.

Driven by technological advancement and changing consumer preferences, the music industry has witnessed, over the past two decades, significant transformations in relation to the way music is accessed and consumed. This data story delves into the distribution formats of albums released between 2000-2020, focusing on vinyls/LPs, CDs, and streaming platforms.

﻿

The advent of digital technology and streaming platforms has revolutionised the way music is distributed, leading to the decline of physical formats – including but not limited to compact discs (CDs). Of late, however, a surprising trend has emerged, driven by nostalgia: vinyl revival.

﻿

The table above lists some of the most renowned music streaming platforms; they have shaped the digital music landscape, and – by providing access to a vast repository of songs – revolutionised the way music is enjoyed. A visual representation of the spatial distribution of a handful of music streaming platforms can be seen in the map below. Each marker pinpoints the headquarters location of a given platform, revealing the international reach of the music streaming industry.

﻿

texts: This study aims at displaying the music organizations in the MusicBo corpus. In particular, we focused on the organizations in Bologna, while uncovering the dominance of violinists within the music scene in the XVIII century.
The total number of organizations found in the MusicBo corpus is 307, mostly being music schools, academies, churches and operas.

As a matter of fact, here we can observe the most mentioned organizations. Amongst them, organizations found in Bologna prevail, given to the fact that the corpus focuses on this city and the role of music there.
Let’s take a closer look at the organizations in Bologna, where the most various organisations are discovered, going from classical academies to the notable Cathedral of San Petronio.
Which Bologna-based organization is the most cited and popular?

The Philharmonic Academy of Bologna is the most mentioned one, given its high status in the Bolognese music panorama between the XVII and XVIII centuries. Its success was especially given by the high-profile members, such as the composer Giacomo Antonio Perti or the renowned violinist Giuseppe Torelli.

The Baroque Concerto, A.J.B. Hutchings (1961) from the MusicBo corpus:

"After his Italian tour of 1770, Burney wrote of Torelli: ' This author, who was a member of the Philharmonic Academy of Bologna and the first violin of the church of San Petronio in the same city, published seven different works for violin."

Let’s look at an overview of Torelli’s life.

Violinists like Torelli had a crucial role in the music scene of the XVIII century, since the violin was one of the most played instruments thanks to its sound harmony and grace, perfectly fit for classical music.

Look at how many violinists existed during this time!

Compared to other players, such as pianists, flutists, guitarists, violists and drummers, violinists were of great importance in classical music and were much more required. The MusicBo corpus has evidence of the popularity of violinists:

The Baroque Concerto, A.J.B. Hutchings (1961)

"bassoonists, flautists and oboists who are less richly served with concertos than are violinists and pianists, but prove that we have yet to explore a field of French concertos in which there are works as attractive as Telemann's, which they notably influenced, and sometimes quite as distinguished by technical skill."

Take a glance at the rise to fame of the violinists through this line chart! It provides a clear depiction of how their popularity has grown over time.
But what was the citizenship of the violinists of the XVIII century?

Europe had a notable larger number of violinists than the rest of the world, due to the fact that classical music was born in France and therefore it mostly expanded in countries of Northern Europe. France, England, Germany, Belgium, Luxembourg and Italy welcome the majority of violinists of the XVIII century. The MusicBo corpus provides an explanation for the growing presence of violinists between the XVII and the XVIII centuries, as shown by the following sentences:

OUTLANDISH AUTHORS: INNOCENZO FEDE AND MUSICAL PATRONAGE AT THE STUART COURT IN LONDON AND IN EXILE, Nicholas Ezra Field (2013)

"The experience of the violin in England was transformed in 1656 with the arrival of Thomas Baltzar, a German violinist recently employed in Sweden at the court Queen dissemination of the violin and its court repertoire into the wider musical community was, of course, the Civil War."

OUTLANDISH AUTHORS: INNOCENZO FEDE AND MUSICAL PATRONAGE AT THE STUART COURT IN LONDON AND IN EXILE, Nicholas Ezra Field (2013)

"The 1773 arrival of Mary and her Italian courtiers nearly coincided with an explosion of popular interest in Italian music caused in large part by the performances of violinist Nicola Matteis, who had appeared in London around 1670 and struggled briefly for recognition before achieving fame around 1672.106 North wrote, “this poor Man as a gratefull legacy to the English Nation left with them a generall favour for the Itallian Manner of Harmony, and after him the French was wholly lay’d aside."

The Baroque Concerto, A.J.B. Hutchings (1961)

"Geminiani was one of the finest violinists of his generation, and he came to England at a time when the example and teaching of a great violinist was badly needed."

If we want to find out which violinists are from a given city, we can check by entering the name of a city and discover who was born there. If available, we will also see some biographical information and an image depicting the artist.

texts: This project provides an overview of the massive cultural phenomenon of the 27 Club and its members. It is quite well-known that the 27 Club includes all the popular artists who suddenly died at 27 years old, most of the time due to suicide, overdose or consequences related to the alcohol consumption or the use of drugs. As far as this project is concerned, we have provided an overview of the members of the 27 Club, but with a particular focus on musicians and singers.

The cultural phenomenon of the 27 Club

A sense of unease surrounds the history of the so-called 27 Club, a group of young talented musicians, mainly rockstars, who are united by a sudden and premature death. We all know the most famous of them: Kurt Cobain, lead singer of Nirvana who committed suicide, Jim Morrison, frontman of The Doors who died of an overdose, as well as Amy Winehouse and Janis Joplin, Brian Jones and Jimi Hendrix. But there are more of them. It would be therefore interesting to look into this creepy Club, that has now turned into a cultural phenomenon, in order to know more about its members.

If you want to have more details about the 27 Club, please click here.

texts: This story aims at delineating the success of one of the greatest American singers representative of country music. Tennessee has always given birth to a great amount of singers performing many different genres. However, country music seems to be the core of this US southern state. For this reason, the main focus of this story will be the woman who is considered the Queen herself of country music, the multi-talented, Tennessee-born Dolly Parton.
Since the early 20th century, Tennessee has been home to many popular singers.
In particular, Tennessee has been recognized worldwide as the capital of country music.
When talking about Tennessee, it is impossible not to mention the Queen of country music: Dolly Parton.

The peak of her career started in the 1970s and continued in the new millenium. Dolly Parton, with a career spanning over 50 years, produced many successful albums starting from the early seventies, till the new millennium. Her discography includes studio, collaborative, live, soundtrack, compilation albums.

As visible in the chart below, the Queen of Country Music, Dolly Parton, has received many different typologawards, which qualify her not only has a very successful singer, but also as an actor and very influential public personality in general.
Beyond the many recognitions, she received many nominations as well, which further identify the Country Music Queen as a very multifaceted and versatile performer.

As many might know, Dolly Parton had a major role in Hannah Montana Disney Channel TV series. Her role in the series is Hannah's (Miley Cyrus) aunt coming from Tennessee. The connection between the two is also very strong in real life. Parton, being a long-time friend of Miley's father, Billy Ray Cyrus, is also the singer's godmother. Apart from that, Miley is one of the most famous performers in the present decade, whose work has been very much influenced by Dolly Parton .

Apart from the roles on the screen, Dolly Parton is mainly known for her successful songs, all of them having a deep country sound. Here are the ones with the lyrics precisely authored by her and inspired by her personal life experience, just like Jolene.
Even though the phenomenon of country music has spread a lot around America and around the world, the tradition remains particularly linked to the United States and to the southern countries.

To conclude, we can say Dolly Parton's contribution has played a major role in shaping American music and its very country touch. Apart from all her records, awards, nominations and versatile roles on the scene, she will always be remembered as the Queen of Country Music born in Tennessee.

texts: Introducing the sensational rock band Måneskin, an Italian rock band formed in 2016 that has captured the hearts of music enthusiasts worldwide, with their edgy performances and their rebellious spirit. This band has reached massive international success, especially after winning the European Song Contest in 2021, becoming the leading exporters of Italian culture all over the world. Today this group continues to redefine the boundaries of modern rock music.
Italian rock bands have always been an expression of passion and energy. With their captivating melodies they have managed to attract listeners across generations. Let's have a look at some numbers:
Now, let's focus on Måneskin!

Performing in the streets in their early days, Måneskin rose to prominence after coming second in the eleventh season of the Italian version of X Factor in 2017. As for their unique name, it was suggested by the bassist Victoria De Angelis, who is half Danish. After a short brainstorming session, they agreed on Måneskin, which means moonlight.

If you want to learn more about their history, click here.
Now we would like to provide you an overview of Måneskin charismatic frontman, Damiano David, whose powerful vocals, fearless attitude, and magnetic charm have made him an icon of modern rock music.

texts: Our story aims at providing an overview of the amount of girl bands that have populated the music scene since the very beginning of the last century. Girl bands, especially the ones who have their origins in the United States of America, are many and diverse. This is the reason why, after delineating very briefly the amount of girl bands, the number of members they are (and were) composed of, we decided to focus on a particular girl band whose career is marked by an impressive amount of records and hits. Scroll down to discover who we are talking about.

The United States have a long-time tradition of bands, and in particular of those bands which can be defined as all-girl or all-boy bands, a very successful concept in the world of music. Here, we will focus in particular on the amount of girl bands originating in the United States.
Girl Bands find their origins in different historic periods. However, as visible in the chart below, the peak of girl band creation is clearly at the very beginning of the 90s.

The genesis of Girl Bands can be traced back to various historical periods, but it was undeniably in the early 1990s that they reached their pinnacle of creation. During this time, a significant number of Girl Bands emerged, with many of them typically featuring a three-member lineup.
A particular girlband we decided to analyze is the multi-award winning all-female group The Destiny's Child. Here is a table delineating the details about each member of this group.

The Destiny's Child has a very substantial musical discography. Apart from all the collaborations, compilations and tracks. However, this is the amount of studio album they published in the years of their activity, The table contains the main studio albums with the titil

Apart from the many nominations, The Destiny's Child actually received many awards of different types. They were recognized for their songs, their dances, their videos and their performances in general.

To conclude, The Destiny's Child's career consists of many records and unforgettable successful songs. The group, though not active anymore, remains one of the greatest hip-hop girl bands to ever dominate the global scene.

texts: The purpose of this story is to provide a general insight of a very renowned musical instrument that has marked an important turning point in the history of music: the violin. In particular, in the following story we will observe and analyse the main features and the history of this splendid instrument. In addition, we will also look more closely at the most influential and talented violinists that, by virtue of their remarkable works, achieved lasting fame and played a fundamental role in the history of violin music.

At the beginning, we proceeded with an exploration of WikiData in order to discover the amount of string instruments that were mentioned inside the knowledge base. A string instrument can be defined as any musical instrument having strings as the medium of sound production.

Then we narrowed-down our research and we proceeded with the exploration of the number of bowed string instruments: they owe their name to the fact that the sound is produced by rubbing the strings by means of horsehair stretched on a bow.
At this point, we looked for a bowed string instrument that had a lot of information both in WikiData and in the Polifonia corpus, and we ultimately chose the violin.

The violin is a bowed string instrument with four strings tuned in perfect fifths. It is the smallest and highest-pitched member of the violin family of string instruments, which also includes the viola, cello and double bass.

A violin is sometimes informally called a fiddle, no matter what kind of music is played on it. The word "violin" comes to us through the Romance languages from the Middle Latin word vitula, meaning "stringed instrument"; this word may also be the source of the Germanic "fiddle". A person who plays the violin is called a violinist or fiddler, and a person who makes or repairs them is called a luthier, or simply a violin maker.

﻿

The violin has been traditionally used as an accompaniment to singing and dancing. It is also an important classical solo instrument, as well as taking pride of place at the front of orchestras.

The violin is both an object of great beauty and symmetry as well as an ingenious work of mechanical design. In the following table, we will look more closely at the main parts that make up this instrument.

The violin has represented orchestral music in the general public for a very long time. However, many people aren’t music enthusiasts and they don’t know that violins exist in many different types. This instrument has changed during its lifespan for various reasons, leading to the production of different models.

In the table below you can find some of the most famous variants, from the first standard violins that already existed in the sixteenth century, such as the baroque violin (which is considered to be the forefather of the modern violin), to more modern variants: for example, the neolin, an electro-acoustic violin which incorporates a fretted fingerboard, cutaway body, and tremolo mechanism based on the electric guitar.

As previously mentioned, the current popularity of the violin is also due to all the incredible musicians that, thanks to their virtuosity and outstanding works, managed to play a crucial role in violin history, leaving an heritage to future generations. At this stage of the research, we looked for the number of male and female violinists inside WikiData.
Then we narrowed down our research, focusing on the influence that these artists still have in musical history and practice. As a consequence, we searched for the ten most influential violinists.
We also made a comparison between the number of musical compositions that several famous violinists composed during the course of their lives.

The map below is useful to have an idea of the number and distribution of violinists around the world. By means of this useful instrument, it is possible to observe that the largest number of violinists is concentrated in Europe, notably in the area between Germany, Austria and Czech Republic.

Click on the text search below to find other famous violinists according to their birth place. For each violinist, It is also possible to observe their most famous works, if the data are available in the WikiData knowledge base.
Among the influential violinists who have been mentioned during the course of this research, there is one famous musician that deserves our attention: George Frideric Handel.

George Frideric Handel was a German-British composer and violinist. Born and raised in Halle (Germany), Handel showed interest in musical instruments and composition since the early stages of his life. After receiving his training, he worked as a composer in Hamburg and Italy before settling in London in 1712, where he lived for the rest of his life.

Handel was a composer of the late Baroque era, and he's deemed to be one of the most prominent composers of his time, influencing a whole generation of composers with his unique blend of Italian, German, and English musical styles. Handel’s works spanned a variety of musical genres, including opera, orchestral music, chamber music, and choral works. He is most famous for his oratorios, which are large-scale musical works for choirs, soloists, and orchestras.

Handel’s musical style was heavily influenced by the Italian Baroque style, which he encountered during his time in Italy. He incorporated elements of the Italian style into his own compositions, blending them with elements of German and English musical traditions. In the following table, some of his most notable works can be observed.

Handel’s musical style was influential in his time and continues to be celebrated today for its combination of beauty, grandeur, and emotional depth. His works are considered milestones of the Baroque era and are an enduring testament to his mastery of the musical arts.

texts: We started our investigation analysing the number of British music bands. In particular, we focused on the rock genre as we are really interested in, and of course we couldn’t help but to center deeply on probably the most renowned and influencing music band of all time: Pink Floyd. They became known for their biting political, social and emotional commentary.

The band was born back to 1963 thanks to the meeting of three architecture students from the University of London, Roger Waters, Nick Mason e Richard Wright. At first, the band didn’t have the unique name with which everyone knows them, but they changed it several times: for example, they used to call themselves Spectrum Five, Tea Set, etc. Finally, they switched to Pink Floyd in 1965, combining the names of two bluesmen, Pink Anderson and Floyd Council.

Pink Floyd began their career at the vanguard of London's underground music scene. They rapidly achieved great success and they were always keen on exploring more into various music genres. In fact, they were the founders of two major music movements: psychedelic space-rock and blues-based progressive rock.

Pink Floyd are known for their wide range of instruments, which belong to different genres and are combined harmoniously to create their songs. Moreover, it’s notorious their use of non-musical sounds, a distinctive feature of the band. Pink Floyd are masters in creating atmospheres, anticipating situations, and giving sensations.

On March 1983 Pink Floyd released The Final Cut, the band’s last album with Roger Waters. From this moment, the bassist will separate from his bandmates to pursue a solo career. In fact, he still tours to sing the band’s most renowned songs in many countries around the world including Italy, where he exhibited in Bologna last April.

Although Pink Floyd were born in the 60s, they have always been open to innovation, and not only from a musical perspective. Indeed with the digital era they joined the social media, and nowadays they are still very influential and have lots of followers.

texts: The aim of our story is to present some information about the piano and to look more closely at the story of one of the world's best-known pianists, Ludwig van Beethoven. The piano is one of the most popular instruments and the most harmonically complete one but, at the same time, it is also the most challenging to master. The piano was invented by the Italian Bartolomeo Cristofori around 1700. However, before his invention, the piano had precursors such as the clavichord, harpsichord and dulcimer. As a result of this complex evolution, the piano can be classified as a string, percussion and keyboard instrument.

As far as the different types of piano are concerned, they are mainly divided into three primary categories, Grand, Upright, and Electronic, which in turn can be further sub-divided. In fact, as the search result above shows, at least 26 types of piano can be identified, a number that also includes unique pianos such as the orphica, a portable piano invented in the 18th century; looking for this particular piano on the web, we also found out that Beethoven, the composer we will focus our attention on, later on, wrote some compositions for the orphica. 

Below, you can see the pictures of these types of pianos.

The piano is one of the most popular musical instruments, this is why these two following tables show some important male and female pianists. Some of them are not only pianists, but they are also active in other fields.

To give an idea of the number and distribution of pianists around the world, the visualization in the map below is useful. From the data retrieved, it can be seen that the largest number of pianists is found in Europe, with a greater concentration in the areas between Germany and Austria.
Over the years, the talent of many outstanding pianists has produced timeless works. Below are some examples of renowned piano pieces.

As observed in the chart above, some of the most famous and important piano pieces, such as the top three Symphony No. 4, Symphony No. 1 and Symphony No. 3, were created by the pianist, composer and conductor Ludwig van Beethoven. Below there are some informations related to this important musician.

Ludwig van Beethoven was born in Bonn, in 1770 and is known as one of the most important pianist of all time. He left a profound legacy through is major compositions. His works span various genres and showcase his creative musical innovations, emotional depth and intellectual complexity. He was active in the music field from 1789 to 1827: the table below shows the most important works of the musician and composer.

﻿However during his career, Beethoven produced an enormous number of musical compositions.

Therefore, the bar chart proves useful in showing visually, and thus more immediately, how prolific his production was. In particular, on the x-axis we find the variable “years”, which runs from 1789 to 1827, while on the y-axis there is the variable “compositions”: it shows the trend of works produced during all those years.

Beethoven represents a prominent figure in the history of classical music, but he actually dedicated his pieces to different genres. Here in the table below are some of the fields of work associated with the musician.

Another important information we retrieved from wikidata, is that his grave is located in the biggest cemetery of Vienna: Vienna Central Cemetery, where other musicians’ graves are located too, such as Schubert’s.

Ludwig van Beethoven's legacy as a composer and musician is an indelible mark on the history of Western classical music. His groundbreaking symphonies, sonatas, concertos, and chamber music compositions have left an enduring impact on the development of classical music. Beyond his compositional ability, Beethoven's artistic vision was fueled by his desire to convey profound human experiences and universal truths through music. His works encapsulate a wide spectrum of emotions, from despair and anguish to joy and triumph, reflecting the complexities of the human condition.

texts: This project will be about one of the best Italian singer songwirter from Bologna: Lucio Dalla. He was of the best Italian singer-songwriters. As a substantial part of Italian culture, we will analyze his life and works.

Lucio Dalla was an Italian singer-songwriter, musician, and actor, widely regarded as one of the most influential and popular figures in Italian music. Born on March 4, 1943, in Bologna, Italy, he became an iconic and beloved artist.

From an early age, Lucio Dalla displayed a passion for music. He started playing the clarinet as a child and later picked up the saxophone, which would become his signature instrument. During his teenage years, he performed with several local bands, exploring various musical genres, including jazz and rock.

In the early 1960s, Dalla embarked on his professional music career, initially working as a session musician and songwriter for other artists. However, it was in the 1970s that he gained widespread recognition and popularity as a solo artist. His breakthrough came with the release of the “Terra di Gaibola” album in 1970, which featured the hit single "4 marzo 1943." The song, a poignant tribute to the victims of the Bologna massacre during World War II, resonated deeply with the Italian public and established Dalla as a socially conscious and introspective songwriter.

Lucio Dalla's music spanned various genres throughout his career, blending elements of pop, rock, jazz, and traditional Italian music. His lyrical prowess and ability to capture human emotions in his songs earned him critical acclaim and a loyal fanbase. Dalla's discography includes numerous successful albums, such as "Automobili" (1976), "Dalla" (1980), and "Cambio" (1990).

One of Lucio Dalla's most iconic and enduring songs is "Caruso," released in 1986. The ballad, inspired by the life of the legendary Italian tenor Enrico Caruso, became an international hit and solidified Dalla's status as a prominent figure in Italian music. His powerful vocal performance and heartfelt delivery in "Caruso" touched the hearts of listeners worldwide, transcending language barriers.

Dalla also ventured into acting. He appeared in several films, including "Luna" (1979) and "To Forget Venice" (1979), showcasing his versatile talents on the big screen. Moreover, he collaborated with various artists throughout his career, both as a songwriter and performer, including renowned Italian singer-songwriter Francesco De Gregori.

Sadly, on March 1, 2012, Lucio Dalla passed away unexpectedly at the age of 68 while on tour in Switzerland. His untimely death shocked the music world and prompted an outpouring of tributes from fans and fellow artists. Dalla's legacy, however, continues to live on through his timeless music, which remains beloved by generations of listeners.

If you want to discover more about his life and works click here

texts: Welcome to a captivating exploration of the musical history of the Red Hot Chili Peppers. From their humble beginnings to becoming global icons, this American rock band has defied genres and expectations, crafting a unique sound that blends rock, funk, punk, and alternative influences. Join us as we trace their evolution and delve into their breakthrough albums. Get ready to dive into the vibrant world of the Red Hot Chili Peppers and discover the magic behind their music.

The music scene in the United States has been a breeding ground for diverse musical genres, each contributing to the country's cultural fabric. Among these genres, rock music has emerged as a powerful and enduring force, captivating audiences with its energetic rhythms. For this reason, a lot of music bands and, in particularly, rock bands were born in this country.

As we can see, the relation between American rock bands and the number of their components is not related to their success: in fact, with just six members, Red Hot Chili Peppers is one of the most important rock bands at the moment. In addition, by using a map that shows the collocation of the recording studios in the USA, we found that there are 75 recording studios spread around the country.

The Red Hot Chili Peppers (often abbreviated as RHCP) are an American rock band known for their energetic blend of rock, funk, and punk music. The band was formed in Los Angeles, California, in 1983. The original lineup consisted of lead vocalist Anthony Kiedis, bassist Flea (Michael Balzary), guitarist Hillel Slovak, and drummer Jack Irons.

Over the years, the Red Hot Chili Peppers have gone through several lineup changes, with members coming and going. The band's music is characterized by a unique fusion of different genres, incorporating elements of funk, punk rock, alternative rock, and psychedelic rock. They are known for their energetic and often eccentric live performances.

Some of their most popular songs include "Under the Bridge," "Californication," "Scar Tissue," "Dani California," and "Give It Away." They have released numerous successful albums throughout their career, including "Blood Sugar Sex Magik," "Californication," and "Stadium Arcadium." Their music has earned them several Grammy Awards and a dedicated fanbase worldwide.

The Red Hot Chili Peppers have been influential in shaping the alternative rock and funk rock genres and they continue to tour and create music nowadays.

texts: Let yourself be guided by this study to find out more about the Russian music scene, in particular in the 19th century! From the popular composers’ group The Five, you will learn how classical musical had a significant role not only Russia during this period, but in the whole world!
Let’s first have a look at how many composers are mentioned in the MusicBo corpus in order to grasp how classical music held its significance from the 1800s to our days.

“The new virtuosity: Before embarking on this new stage, we have to consider a certain number of elements in musical life at the time, personalities as well as circumstances, coinciding with the careers of the first great 'classical composers', going into the nineteenth century while still belonging in spirit to an earlier age.”

Source: An illustrated history of Music, Marc Pincherle (1959)

 

Therefore, as the sentence from the MusicBo corpus is supported by the number of composers found, it is clear how the 19th century was the prime for classical music.

The majority of composers are found in Europe, of course, due to the fact that particularly classical music started to develop from there and then it expanded worldwide. In particular, it is worth mentioning the role of classical composers in Russia, thanks to whom classical music and folklore came together.
So, what are the most popular and cited Russian composers according to MusicBo?

It is quite interesting to notice that 5 out of the 10 composers are all part of the same composition group: The Five, a Russian composition group made up of the greatest Russian composers of that time: Korsakov, Borodin, Balakirev, Cui and Mussorgsky. The Five revolutionized the Russian music scene of the 19th century.

The following sentences, retrieved from the MusicBo corpus, reveal the importance and the great influence of The Five on the development and success of classical compositions in Russia:

 

“With Mili Balakirev (1837-1910) we come to the famous "Group of Five" (or "Mighty handful") composed of himself and his four chief disciples, four amateurs named Cesar Cui, Mussorgsky (both army officers), Borodin (chemist) and Rimsky-Korsakov (naval officer).”

Source: An illustrated history of Music, Marc Pincherle (1959)

 

“Balakirev had taught himself composition and orchestration by analysing the works of the great composers.”

Source: An illustrated history of Music, Marc Pincherle (1959)

 

“His genius as an orchestrator, so dazzlingly revealed, for example, in Mussorgsky's Pictures from an Exhibition, is based on the most minute and thorough exploration of every instrumental possibility.”

Source: An illustrated history of Music, Marc Pincherle (1959)

 

Let’s learn more about these five great composers!

You would think it would be odd to find as their occupations chemist, military officers and pedagogue. However, it was quite common during the Russian Empire for artists to have more than one job, often more practical ones.
Click here to listen to one of their works!

The Five were the prominent composers of the 19th century in Russia. As a matter of fact, they introduced their country to a distinct national style of classical music, and they had so much influence on the music scene of the time, that many Russian artists followed their lead, and the practice of classical music grew exponentially. Look at how many Russian composition groups can be found after the guidance of The Five!

As you can see from the line chart, the 1800s was a flourishing period for classical music in Russia. And guess what? We owe it all to Emperor Peter the Great, whose openness to Europe brought the whole musical scene to Russia.

There is another peak, during the Soviet Union. You're probably wondering, why? Among the followers of the Five, we find the most popular Soviet composers. We're talking about legends, including Shostakovich, Prokofiev, and Stravinsky.

How about the rest of the world? Did composers thrive the most during the 19th century also in other countries? Let’s find out by seeing how many composers can be found in each country during the 1800s.

The 19th century was a musical revolution in Russia, all thanks to a group of highly influential composers known as The Five. They completely transformed the music scene and left a lasting legacy. And you won't believe it, but their genius even spread to the Soviet Union, legendary composers such as Shostakovich, Prokofiev, and Stravinsky.

The evidence from the MusicBo corpus confirms the significant contributions of The Five and other Russian composers. As we have seen, they left an indelible mark on Russia's musical landscape, and their influence continues to be felt today. Indeed, they laid the foundations for an extraordinary musical journey that continues to inspire musicians around the world, thereby planting the seeds of musical greatness that continue to blossom with each beautiful note.

texts: This project will be about one of the best Italian singer songwirter from Bologna: Cesare Cremonini. He was of the best Italian singer-songwriters. As a substantial part of Italian culture, we will analyze his life and works.

Cesare Cremonini is an Italian singer-songwriter and musician who has gained widespread acclaim for his soulful voice, introspective lyrics, and captivating melodies. Born on March 27, 1980, in Bologna, Italy, Cremonini developed a passion for music at a young age and embarked on a remarkable journey that would establish him as one of the most prominent figures in the Italian music industry.

Growing up in a family that appreciated the arts, Cesare Cremonini was exposed to various musical genres from an early age. He began playing the piano at the age of six and quickly discovered his innate talent for music. As he honed his skills, Cremonini started writing his own songs, showcasing his creativity and knack for storytelling.

In 1996, Cremonini formed the band Senza Filtro with some of his friends; its name was changed in Lùnapop in 1997. The group gained much popularity, thanks to their infectious pop-rock sound and catchy songs. Their debut album, "...Squérez?" released in 1999, became a commercial success in Italy and spawned several hit singles. Cesare's distinctive voice and charismatic stage presence quickly made him a fan favorite.

However, despite the band's success, Cesare Cremonini felt the need to pursue a solo career to explore his artistic vision further. In 2002, he released his first solo album, "Bagus," which showcased a more introspective and mature sound compared to his earlier work with Lùnapop. The album received critical acclaim, and Cremonini's solo career was off to a promising start.

Over the following years, Cesare Cremonini continued to release a string of successful albums, each displaying his growth as an artist and his ability to connect with audiences on a profound level. His music became known for its emotional depth, tackling love, loss, and personal introspection themes. Cremonini's distinctive voice, characterized by its soulful timbre and emotive delivery, further solidified his position as one of Italy's most beloved musicians.

Some of his most notable albums include "Maggese" (2005), "1999-2010 The Greatest Hits" (2010), "La teoria dei colori" (2012), and "Possibili Scenari" (2017). These albums spawned numerous chart-topping singles, earning Cremonini numerous awards and accolades throughout his career.

Beyond his musical accomplishments, Cesare Cremonini is known for his philanthropic endeavors and dedication to social causes. He has been involved in various charitable initiatives, using his platform and resources to positively impact society.

texts: Our focus is on orchestras and their historical and contemporary significance in the musical landscape.

Orchestra

"a musical organisation consisting of a group of instrumentalists including string players"
One of the first results we retrieved from the MusicBo Knowledge Graph was the definition of an orchestra which we thought to be an excellent starting point for our exploration.
This number proves that orchestras in Italy and in Bologna in particular are a powerful symbol of the country's vibrant cultural history and deep-rooted musical heritage.

Last but not least, while querying the KG (Knowledge Graph), we attempted to establish a connection between orchestras and people mentioned. The queries returned no results for triples containing both these entities. However, when we used an additional variable, we retrieved results, although all of them referred to San Petronio as a person or as a name for the orchestra. We decided to explore this connection using a more extensive KG, namely Wikidata story_1687783155.447632.html

texts: Completion of the data about orchestras extracted from Wikidata Knowledge Graph
We started to explore what kind of data can be found on Wikidata about orchestras from Italy and decided to organise them as a counter and a table .

We thought it would be also interesting to compare it with the number of orchestras in the world and in other European countries. The map in our data story displays orchestras in the world while the numbers for orchestras in Europe are organised in a bar chart.

Since we haven’t found a direct connection between orchestras and people in the MusicBo KG, we launched queries to explore it on Wikidata service and Wikidata endpoint. The most obvious connection was with conductors or art directors. We created a text search for orchestras from different countries where we presented the names of the orchestras with their country of origin as well as the orchestras’ leaders.

Some of these prominent musicians were mentioned on Wikidata in connection with several orchestras. For this reason, we added an action to display all the musical organisations where these musicians participate when this information is available.
