texts: This project will be about one of the best Italian singer songwriters from Bologna: Raffaella Carrà. She was of the best Italian singer-songwriters. As a substantial part of Italian culture, we will analyze her life and works.

Raffaella Carrà was an iconic Italian singer, actress, television personality, and dancer, whose charismatic performances and influential career spanned over five decades. Born on June 18, 1943, in Bologna, Italy, as Raffaella Maria Roberta Pelloni, she became one of the most beloved and influential figures in Italian entertainment history. Carrà's versatile talents, combined with her infectious energy and groundbreaking contributions to music and television, made her an international superstar.

Carrà began her career in the 1960s as a dancer and chorus girl in various Italian television programs. Her talent and captivating presence quickly caught the attention of audiences, leading to her breakthrough as a singer with the release of her debut single, "Fortissimo," in 1965. The song achieved significant success and marked the beginning of a fruitful music career.

In the 1970s, Carrà's popularity soared, both in Italy and internationally. She released numerous hit singles, including "Tanti Auguri," "A far l'amore comincia tu," and "Fiesta," which became anthems of the era and established her as a symbol of female empowerment and liberation. Carrà's unique blend of disco, pop, and dance music, accompanied by her vibrant choreography and glamorous style, made her an idol for millions of fans.

Alongside her music career, Carrà ventured into acting, starring in a variety of films and television shows. She showcased her acting prowess in movies such as "Ma che musica maestro" (1971) and "Pronto... c'è una certa Giuliana per te" (1971). Carrà also hosted her own television programs, such as "Canzonissima" and "Fantastico," where she showcased her talent for hosting, dancing, and entertaining audiences with her infectious charm.

In the 1980s, Carrà's influence expanded beyond Italy. She gained popularity across Europe, particularly in Spain and Latin America, where she hosted her own Spanish-language television shows and achieved immense success with hits like "En el amor todo es empezar" and "Lucas".

Beyond her music and television career, Carrà was also known for her philanthropic work and advocacy. She supported various charitable causes, including HIV/AIDS research and the rights of women and the LGBTQ+ community. Her humanitarian efforts further endeared her to her fans and solidified her legacy as a compassionate and influential figure.

On July 5, 2021, Raffaella Carrà passed away at the age of 78 in Rome, Italy, leaving behind a remarkable legacy.

If you want to learn more about her life and works please click here.

WHERE {?s rdf:type <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/Publication>}

SELECT ?label (count(distinct ?s) as ?count)  
WHERE {?s rdf:type ?class; <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/name> ?name   
FILTER regex(str(?class), "(?:^http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/)")      BIND (REPLACE(STR(?class), "^.+?([^/#]+)$", "$1") as ?label)}

GROUP BY ?label  
ORDER BY DESC(?count) 
LIMIT 10

WHERE {?s rdf:type <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/Person> . ?frameInstance ?p ?s ; rdf:type ?frame . ?frame rdfs:label ?frameLabel . ?frame rdfs:subClassOf dul:Event .   
?s <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/name> ?label  
FILTER (!regex(str(?s), "san_petronio",'i'))}  
   
GROUP BY ?label   
ORDER BY DESC (?count)
LIMIT 10

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> 
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>

WHERE {?s rdf:type <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/Person> . ?frameInstance ?p ?s ; rdf:type ?frame . 
#?frame rdfs:label ?label  
BIND (REPLACE(STR(?p), "^.*/([^/]*)$", "$1") as ?label)  
FILTER (!regex(str(?p), "entity_"))  
FILTER (!regex(str(?p), "#"))  
FILTER (!regex(str(?p), "subset")) }  
GROUP BY ?label  
ORDER BY DESC(?count) 
LIMIT 10

WHERE {   
SERVICE <https://query.wikidata.org/bigdata/namespace/wdq/sparql> { 
    ?point wdt:P31/wdt:P279* wd:Q515 .  
    ?point p:P625 ?coords_stmt .  
    ?coords_stmt ps:P625 ?coords; 
    psv:P625 [  wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat;  wikibase:geoLongitude ?long ] . }

  ?cityUri rdf:type amr:City ;  owl:sameAs ?point ;  amr:name ?label .  
    FILTER (regex(str(?point), "http://www.wikidata.org/entity/", "i"))  
    ?frameInstance ?p ?cityUri ; rdf:type ?frame .
}
}

texts: The muBOsic Knowledge Graph (KG), documenting Bologna's pivotal role in the European Musical Heritage, is created using an automated Text-to-Knowledge Graph pipeline on a multilingual and diachronic corpus.

We analysed muBOsic KG through the lens of Named Entities Recognition (NER), a standard Natural Language Processing task. We discovered that the entanglement of Bologna and music history is a composite network of people, places, and organizations. Publications, works of art and books are frequently mentioned in the corpus, revealing that Bologna was an important centre for artistic production.
Among the many people in the muBOsic corpus, Rossini is the most frequently mentioned as involved in events and situations.

What roles did people linked to music and the city of Bologna played? Characters relevant to the music scene that crossed Bologna over the centuries were mostly authors and artists, but also office holders, writers, agents, and editors. Such insights suggest that Bologna was both a point of reference for artistic production and for music-related activities, as criticism and business. Last but not least, Bologna attracted music students.

This map shows that, in muBosic corpus, may other places throughout Europe are mentioned in relation to Bologna. Unveiling an intricate net of connections, this data underlines Bologna's pivotal role as a pulsating hub within the European music scene.

l3RukqzW.title: Gaspare Spontini

queries.query:
SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(?composer) AS ?count) 

WHERE { 

     ?composer wdt:P106 wd:Q36834;  # composer 

               wdt:P19 wd:Q38; #italian 

               wdt:P21 ?gender . # gender 

      

     SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en". 

          ?gender rdfs:label  ?label. 

      }
 

} 

GROUP BY ?label 

ORDER BY DESC(?count)

texts: The following story will explore the WikiData knowledge base to discover the most significant points and events in the Italian composer Gaspare Spontini’s personal and professional life. After a general exploration of the WikiData knowledge base with the aim to discover the quantity of people and artists in comparison with MusicBO, we will then narrow down our research analyzing the composers recorded in WikiData, to eventually focus on our main object of the story: Gaspare Spontini. In particular, the story will present an overview of his biography, his occupations and fields of work, as well as the awards he received during his life, the academy where he worked and the cities where he lived. At the end of the story, there will be an insight into the Museum Gaspare Spontini, its location and the visitors he had per year.

The aim of these counters is to compare the amount of data recorded on the Wikidata and knowledge database, concerning the categories of Items we are interested in. The counters start form the broader category of “person” to narrow down till the more specific one of “composer”

Among the Italian composers there is Gaspare Spontini, perhaps less known than his main contemporary artist of the 18th century, but he is an artist of remarkable talent. We discovered this composer by digging in the Polifonia corpus and we were curious to know more about him.  

Here it is an example of context from MusicBO: 

“[...] a few of the chorus gathered in a semicircle around Spontini, in order to have a look at that remarkable man, as he held forth with wonderful effect on the requirements of true theatrical art.” 

Scroll down to discover more about this artist, admired and respected in all Europe and who’s worthy of attention. 



﻿

After studying at the conservatory in Naples with Nicola Sala as teacher, he then started working at some comedies in Italy. However, he spent most of his career life in Paris, where he started working at the Opéra becoming one of the greatest Italian composers of his age, admired by Cherubini, Beethoven, Weber and Rossini. 

Because of the Bourbon Restoration, his works weren't considered as before, leading him to leave Paris for Berlin (at the time under the Kingdom of Prussia), where his operas had already achieved success, where he stayed until 1842.

Spontini was a member of the Académie des Beaux-Arts from June 15th 1839 when he replaced Ferdinando Paer, an Italian composer of German origins, to January 14th 1851 when he was then replaced by Ambroise Thomas, a French composer particularly famous for his work Mignon.

The Gaspare Spontini Museum is located in Maiolata Spontini, in the house where the composer and his wife spent the last years of their lives. Inside, we can find some music sheets, manuscripts, two pianos and some paintings depicting the staging of Spontini's French works, like The Miltondel, The Vestal and others.

-QO5tO8t.title: Exploring MusicBo dataset

queries.query:
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> 
PREFIX dul: <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/dul/DUL.owl#>	
SELECT (COUNT(?person) as ?count) 
WHERE {
?person rdf:type <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/Person> .	
?person <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/name> ?label 
}

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX pblr: <https://w3id.org/framester/pb/localrole/>
SELECT (COUNT(?artist) AS ?count)
WHERE {
	?artist pblr:artist ?person .
	?person rdf:type <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/Person> .    
}

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX wn30: <https://w3id.org/framester/wn/wn30/instances/>

SELECT (COUNT(?instrument) AS ?count)

WHERE {

  ?instrument rdf:type ?instrumentType .
  ?instrumentType rdfs:subClassOf wn30:supersense-noun_artifact .
}

texts: This project has the aim to investigate the popularity of rock bands and rock singers born in Emilia Romagna. The investigation retrieves information from the Wikidata corpus and takes into account Twitter followers of famous rock singers and rock bands born in the Emilia Romagna region after 1940. Furthermore, the project provides the reader with images, charts, tables and maps in order to better understand the impact and popularity of the most famous rock musicians and bands formed in Emilia Romagna.

Firstly, let’s take a look at the number of rock singers born in Emilia Romagna after 1940. Our aim was to investigate the popularity of rock music in Emilia Romagna and their ongoing impact. That is why we decided to rule out singers who were born before 1940. Moreover, we wanted to understand how many singers can be considered to belong to the rock genre according to the Wikidata corpus.

As we can see, the Wikidata corpus does not retrieve many rock singers born in Emilia Romagna. Without adding the property “subclass of” Wikidata only finds 8 singers. That is why we thought that by adding said property we would be able to get more results. Unfortunately, if we include other subclasses of “singer” such as “songwriter” or “musician” we only get 1 more result.

Now let’s observe who are the first 10 rock singers born in Emilia Romagna after 1940, ordered from the oldest to the youngest. This table provides us with the singers' full name, their birthdate, their birthplace, their sex and, if available, an image of each singer.

With this research we wanted to understand who are the 9 rock singers present in the Wikidata corpus. Moreover, we wanted to observe their birthdate, birthplace and sex. We also decided to include an image, if available. One of the most interesting observations we made is the fact that there is only one female singer in this list, Laura Pausini. This highlights the fact that in Emilia Romagna it is easier to find male rather than female rock singers.

Now let’s take a look at a doughnut chart containing the first 7 genres in Emilia Romagna after 1940 according to the number of singers. This query is useful to investigate the impact and popularity of rock music compared to other music genres.

The results show us that rock music is not the most popular genre in Emilia Romagna. Pop music is at the top with 23 singers, whereas rock music is actually in second place with only 9 singers. What is interesting is the fact that the third most popular genre is opera music (6 singers). In fact, this genre seems to be even more popular than pop rock music (only 1 singer), according to the Wikidata corpus.

After focusing mainly on rock singers, let’s take a look at a list of rock bands formed in Emilia Romagna (after 1940). This research provides us with the name of the band, its date and city of formation and, if available, an image of the band.

The results show us that there are more rock bands (21) than rock singers (9) according to the Wikidata corpus. Moreover, more than half of them were formed in Bologna.

Now we aim at showing in which city rock singers and rock bands were born. Indeed, we want to verify which is the province with the highest number of rock artists and which is the one with the lowest.

As we can state from our results there are 2 rock artists in the province of Piacenza, 5 in the province of Parma, 4 in the province of Reggio Emilia, 6 in the province of Modena, 14 in the province of Bologna, 1 in the province of Ravenna, 1 in the province of Forlì-Cesena and 1 in the province of Rimini. Therefore, Bologna is the province with the highest number of rock singers and groups in Emilia-Romagna. On the other hand, Rimini is the province with the lowest number of rock artists.

Now let’s focus on their Twitter followers. First of all, we’ve decided to take a look at the number of Twitter followers of rock singers born in Emilia-Romagna after 1940. Then, we’ve decided to compare the previous results with the number of Twitter followers of rock bands born in Emilia-Romagna after 1940. We want to verify if rock singers actually have more followers than rock bands since rock bands tend to be more world famous than singers.

The results show us that Twitter followers of rock singers are 787.933. Therefore, rock singers have more Twitter followers than rock bands. This result is surprising due to the fact that rock bands are usually more well-known than singers and when we think about rock music in general, bands are the first to come to mind. 

Lastly, let’s take a look at a barchart showing us who are the singers and bands with the highest number of followers on Twitter.

Luciano Ligabue appears to be the most followed artist on Twitter in Emilia-Romagna. Besides, the second one is Laura Pausini. The former is a rock singer, meanwhile the latter belongs to the music genre pop-rock that is a subcategory of rock music. Vasco Rossi is the third artist mentioned, although there is a significant difference in the number of followers between him and Laura Pausini. The remaining artists are presented in the following order: Zucchero, Neck, Pooh, Lo Stato Sociale, Helia, Marta sui Tubi and Alessandro Cortini. The presence of Laura Pausini as the only female singer in the above-mentioned chart is noteworthy since we tend to believe that there are more male rock artists than female. Furthermore, four out of ten names are male bands, that are Pooh, Lo Stato Sociale, Helia and Marta sui Tubi. Lastly, Alessandro Corsini is the only composer and music producer present in the chart.

8TaxJyd-.title: Popularity of Musical Artists from Emilia-Romagna

queries.query:
SELECT ?label (SUM(?length) AS ?count)
WHERE {
  ?singer rdf:type dbo:MusicalArtist ;   # Musical artists
      	?placeProperty ?birthPlace ;
      	rdfs:label ?singerLabel;
      	dbo:wikiPageLength   ?length.   # Length of wikipedia page of the artist
  ?birthPlace dbo:subdivision  dbr:Emilia-Romagna .   	# birthPlace is in Emilia Romagna

   FILTER (?placeProperty = dbo:birthPlace || ?placeProperty = dbo:hometown)       	# birthPlace is object of property dbo:birthPlace or dbo:hometown
  ?singer rdfs:label ?label .
  FILTER(lang(?label) = "en")

}
GROUP BY ?label
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
 LIMIT 10

SELECT ?label (COUNT(?linkedPages) AS ?count)
WHERE {
  ?singer rdf:type dbo:MusicalArtist ;   # Musical artists
      	?placeProperty ?birthPlace ;
      	rdfs:label ?singerLabel.
  ?linkedPages dbo:wikiPageWikiLink ?singer.
  ?birthPlace dbo:subdivision  dbr:Emilia-Romagna .   	# birthPlace is in Emilia Romagna

   FILTER (?placeProperty = dbo:birthPlace || ?placeProperty = dbo:hometown)       	# birthPlace is object of property dbo:birthPlace or dbo:hometown
  ?singer rdfs:label ?label .
  FILTER(lang(?label) = "en")
}
GROUP BY ?label
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
 LIMIT 10

SELECT ?label (COUNT(?linkedPages) AS ?count)
WHERE {
  ?singer rdf:type dbo:MusicalArtist ;   # Musical artists
		  ?placeProperty ?birthPlace ;
                   dbo:birthDate ?birthDate ;
		  rdfs:label ?singerLabel.
  ?linkedPages dbo:wikiPageWikiLink ?singer.
  ?birthPlace dbo:subdivision  ?region ;   # birthPlace is italy but not in Emilia Romagna
            	rdfs:label ?birthPlaceLabel.
  ?region dbo:country ?state.
  ?state rdfs:label "Italy"@en.
	 
  FILTER (?placeProperty = dbo:birthPlace || ?placeProperty = dbo:hometown) 		  # birthPlace is object of property dbo:birthPlace or dbo:hometown
  ?singer rdfs:label ?label .
FILTER (YEAR(?birthDate) > 1930)            # Filter for birth after 1930
FILTER(lang(?label) = "en")
FILTER (langMatches(lang(?birthPlaceLabel), "en"))           		 # just English language
}
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
LIMIT 12

SELECT ?label (SUM(?length) AS ?count)
WHERE {
  ?singer rdf:type dbo:MusicalArtist ;   # Musical artists
		  ?placeProperty ?birthPlace ;
                   dbo:birthDate ?birthDate ;
		  rdfs:label ?singerLabel;
                  dbo:wikiPageLength ?length.   # Length of wikipedia page of the artist
  ?birthPlace dbo:subdivision  ?region ;   # birthPlace is italy but not in Emilia Romagna
            	rdfs:label ?birthPlaceLabel.
  ?region dbo:country ?state.
  ?state rdfs:label "Italy"@en.
	 
  FILTER (?placeProperty = dbo:birthPlace || ?placeProperty = dbo:hometown) 		  # birthPlace is object of property dbo:birthPlace or dbo:hometown
  ?singer rdfs:label ?label .
FILTER (YEAR(?birthDate) > 1930)            # Filter for birth after 1930
FILTER(lang(?label) = "en")
FILTER (langMatches(lang(?birthPlaceLabel), "en"))           		 # just English language
}
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
LIMIT 12

texts: This project aims to explore the potential of Wikipedia as a reliable source for understanding the popularity and impact of musical artists born in the Emilia-Romagna region. Wikipedia has emerged as a significant platform for documenting and disseminating information on various topics, including the arts and entertainment industry. By analysing the content and metrics associated with Emilia-Romagna-born musicians' Wikipedia pages, this investigation seeks to evaluate the extent to which Wikipedia reflects the popularity and influence of these artists.

First of all, let's have a look at the list of musical artists from Emilia-Romagna. Below is a partial list of the musical artists that Emilia-Romagna has given us, taken from DBpedia and arranged chronologically by year of birth. Look at the table to discover their places of birth, the exact dates of birth and to see the reference images.

The DBpedia database provides the length of the corresponding Wikipedia page for each artist. Therefore, we wonder whether this length might be a good indicator of the level of popularity of the musical artist abroad. Indeed, the Wikipedia pages considered are in English. Below we provide the ranking of the TOP 10 artists according to the number of characters on the corresponding Wikipedia page.

The results show that Raffaella Carrà has the longest and most detailed Wikipedia page, by a considerable margin over all the others. In fact, the number of characters on her page is more than double that of the second artist on the list, the singer Nek. While Raffaella Carrà's popularity is unquestionable, as she is internationally loved, it is plausible to speculate that other factors, such as the fact that her life is already over, explain the data obtained.

Let's now explore another possible measure of artists' popularity by looking at which musical artists have the highest number of mentions (always accompanied by a hyperlink) on Wikipedia. Below is the ranking of the TOP 10 artists based on this new criterion.

We observe a clear difference with the results of the previous query. Lucio Dalla is now the most cited Emilian musical artist on other Wikipedia pages. This may suggest the fact that Lucio Dalla participated in more cultural events than other Emilian artists.

Knowing the prestige and popularity of the Sanremo Festival in Italy, we will check the number of times Dalla has been cited on the Wikipedia pages of Sanremo Festivals over the years and compare it with the number of times Carrà has been cited on the same pages.

Of course, it has to be taken into account that Dalla participated in the Sanremo Festival six times, while Carrà only took part in it three times.

To conclude the research, we looked at the popularity of other Italian singers, this time not born in Emilia-Romagna. The aim was to compare the new data with the previous results obtained specifically for this region, in order to obtain a more complete assessment of the popularity of the musical artists and its correlation with the number of online mentions.

For this reason, the number of mentions of other Italian musical artists in Wikipedia is reported below, as well as the length of their own Wikipedia pages in terms of number of characters.

a-LzrTFa.title: ABBA - An Overview

queries.query:
SELECT DISTINCT (year(xsd:dateTime(?date)) as ?label)  (COUNT(?label) AS ?count)
WHERE {
     ?band ?a wd:Q215380 . # musical group
     ?band wdt:P495 wd:Q34 . # from sweden
     ?band wdt:P2031 ?date . # formation year         
     SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en".
          ?band rdfs:label ?label.
      }

}

GROUP BY ?count ?date
ORDER BY ?label
LIMIT 50

SELECT DISTINCT ?song ?songLabel (year(xsd:dateTime(?publicationDate)) as ?publication) WHERE { ?song wdt:P175 wd:Q18233 ; wdt:P407 wd:Q1860 . ?song wdt:P577 ?publicationDate . SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en".} } ORDER BY ?publicationDate LIMIT 20

SELECT (?instrumentLabel AS ?label) (COUNT(?member) AS ?count) 
WHERE { 
  wd:Q18233 wdt:P527 ?member. 
  ?member wdt:P1303 ?instrument. 
  ?instrument rdfs:label ?instrumentLabel. 
FILTER (lang(?instrumentLabel) = "en"). }
GROUP BY ?instrument ?instrumentLabel 
ORDER BY DESC(?count)

texts: This story will explore one of the most successful pop music groups of all times: the ABBA. Even though the formation of the Swedish band dates back to fifty years ago, their resonance is still alive in the present day, since they left an indelible trace in the worldwide music culture thanks to their lively pieces of work and their unique style. No other could take over ABBA’s role in shaping the pop music we listen and love today, and it’s not hard to think that their legacy will continue for years to come.

texts: Founded in the UK, this pop-rock band is continuing to leave an unprecedented mark in the music scene of the XXI century, becoming one of the most iconic and beloved bands of our time. With its colorful performances and hits, Coldplay has achieved extraordinary international success, blending elements of pop, rock, alternative, and electronic music with introspective lyrics and captivating melodies. The most explored themes are love, hope, introspection, and the human experience, resonating deeply with listeners worldwide.

Welcome to our story! To kick off our project, may we present you Coldplay!

A little side note, Phil Harvey is known as the creative director of the band, which makes him the fifth “essence” of the band.
Applauses for Chris Martin! Take a look at his cheerful attitude shining through this photo!

Now, let’s have a look at Coldplay’s instruments and multiple souls, as well as other bands that share their same musical styles and country of origin. Not enough? The band's influences, famous songs, and albums are also here for you to enjoy!
You made it to the bottom! But before leaving, you may be interested in the number of pop-rock bands in the UK, as well as their start of activity.

PREFIX wd: <http://www.wikidata.org/entity/>
PREFIX wdt: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/direct/>
PREFIX wikibase: <http://wikiba.se/ontology#>
PREFIX bd: <http://www.bigdata.com/rdf#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
 
SELECT DISTINCT ?human ?humanLabel
WHERE
{
	VALUES ?professions {wd:Q177220 wd:Q639669}
	?human wdt:P31 wd:Q5 .
	?human wdt:P106 ?professions .
	?human wdt:P136 ?genre .
	?human wikibase:statements ?statementcount .
	?genre rdfs:label ?genreLabel . 
	FILTER CONTAINS(?genreLabel, "rock") .
	FILTER (?statementcount > 50 ) .
	SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en" }
}
ORDER BY DESC(?sitelinks)
LIMIT 20

PREFIX rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
PREFIX dbpedia-owl: <http://dbpedia.org/ontology/>
PREFIX dbpedia: <http://dbpedia.org/resource/>

SELECT ?event
WHERE {
  ?event rdf:type dbpedia-owl:Event .
  ?event dbpedia-owl:genre dbpedia:Rock_music .
}

PREFIX wd: <http://www.wikidata.org/entity/>
PREFIX wdt: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/direct/>
PREFIX wikibase: <http://wikiba.se/ontology#>
PREFIX xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#>
PREFIX bd: <http://www.bigdata.com/rdf#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
 
SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(?item) AS ?count)
WHERE {
 	?item wdt:P31 wd:Q482994 . # album
{?item wdt:P136 wd:Q11399 .} #genre
UNION {?item wdt:P136 wd:Q7749 .}
 ?item wdt:P577 ?date . #publication date
 
 SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en".	
  	}
   BIND(YEAR(xsd:dateTime(?date)) AS ?label)
}
 
GROUP BY ?label
ORDER BY ?label
LIMIT 20

texts: The roots of rock & roll have been hotly discussed by music analysts and historians. There is widespread consensus that it emerged in the Southern United States - an area that produced the majority of the big early rock and roll artists - through the convergence of numerous influences that embodied a fusion of African musical tradition and European equipment. Because of the migration of many former slaves and their descendants to major urban centers such as St. Louis, Memphis, New York City, Detroit, Chicago, Cleveland, and Buffalo, black and white residents were living in closer proximity than ever before, hearing each other's music and even beginning to emulate each other's fashions. This process of "cultural collision" was facilitated by radio stations that made white and black forms of music available to both populations, the development and distribution of the vinyl record, and African-American musical styles such as jazz and swing that were adopted by white performers.

PREFIX wd: <http://www.wikidata.org/entity/>
PREFIX wdt: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/direct/>
PREFIX wikibase: <http://wikiba.se/ontology#>
PREFIX bd: <http://www.bigdata.com/rdf#>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
 
SELECT DISTINCT ?label
WHERE {
  ?band wdt:P31 wd:Q215380 .
  ?band wdt:P495 wd:Q38 .
  ?band wdt:P136 ?genre .
  
  ?genre wdt:P279 wd:Q11399.
  ?genre rdfs:label ?label .
 FILTER(LANG(?label) = "en") # Filter by English language label
 SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en" }
}
LIMIT 10

texts: The present project traces the rise of rock 'n' roll as a cultural phenomenon, examining data on album releases and highlighting influential rock artists and their contributions.

The roots of Rock 'n' Roll have been hotly discussed by music analysts and historians. There is widespread consensus that it emerged in the Southern United States - an area that produced the majority of the big early rock 'n' roll artists - through the convergence of numerous influences that embodied a fusion of African musical tradition and European equipment. Because of the migration of many former slaves and their descendants to major urban centers such as St. Louis, Memphis, New York City, Detroit, Chicago, Cleveland, and Buffalo, black and white residents were living in closer proximity than ever before, hearing each other's music and even beginning to emulate each other's fashions. This process of "cultural collision" was facilitated by radio stations that made white and black forms of music available to both populations, the development and distribution of the vinyl record, and African-American musical styles such as jazz and swing that were adopted by white performers.

GghVmi8y.title: British Rock Bands - An Overview

queries.query:
SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(?item) AS ?count)
WHERE {
     ?band ?a wd:Q5741069 . # rock band 
     ?band wdt:P495 wd:Q145 . # from uk
     ?band wdt:P527 ?item . 
     SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en".
          ?band rdfs:label         ?label.
      }



}
GROUP BY ?label
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
LIMIT 30

SELECT DISTINCT ?label (COUNT(distinct ?band) as ?count) 
WHERE {
     ?band ?a wd:Q5741069 . # rock band 
     ?band wdt:P495 wd:Q145 . # from uk
     ?band wdt:P737 ?influencer .
          SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "en".
          ?influencer rdfs:label         ?label.
      }
}

GROUP BY ?label ?count 
ORDER BY DESC(?count)
LIMIT 10

texts: This data story explores the resources related to British Rock music available on Wikidata, the centralized, linked data repository for all Wikimedia projects, with the goal of overviewing this music genre from statistical point of view.
